SENT.plain: Two necropsy cases of chronic encephalomyelitis of unknown aetiology are presented
Skin hyperreactivity occurred in both cases although there were no mucocutaneo-ocular symptoms
There was confluent perivenous necrosis with marked glio-mesenchymal reactions and persistent inflammatory changes, predominantly in the diencephalon and brain stem
These cases are clinico-pathologically analogous to Neuro-Behcet's syndrome
